reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Sagu is simply the best place to stay on Ilja Grande. If you like good food, luxury and comfort this is the place. The owner is Italian so he knows all about the european standards.
reviews.title: Sagu = Quality on Ilja Grande!

reviews.text: Something most Brasillians never heard of!!!
reviews.title: Great Location, Needs Better Management

likes.disliked: — Lack of customer service, insects, lack of decent Internet access.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed on several places on the island but they never came close to the quality that the Sagu has to offer. They have there own restaurant which serves the best food on the island combined with a magnificent view on the bay.
reviews.title: Avoid it at all costs!
Great Location
reviews.text: Staff speaks good English and were very nice to us.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don´t trust the google situation information. Sagu is very near of the main village of Ilha Grande and you can walk easily there (wear flip flops because part of the way is by beach sand) .
reviews.title: Beutiful island. Nice hotel
We wish we could still be there!
reviews.text: The Sagu is not as beatiful as its website shows but is very nice. The rooms are big and the bathroom very confortable, with good toileteries. The furniture is a bit old. Perhaps they were trying to show charm at the beginning but now they look somehow cramped.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is good with eggs cooked to order.
reviews.title: Serene Sagu

likes.liked: — Distance from town, Veranda with view, Private and Romantic
likes.disliked: — Noise Pollution from dogs, flies at breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a slightly bitter experience when we had to leave the room before 12:00 when we were leaving at 13:00 and the hotel was almost empty. So we had to take our final shower in a small, old and unconfortable bathroom they have for these situations. Except for that, the service was OK (though they should update the bus to Rio timetable info).
reviews.title: Small, beautiful, exclusive, welcoming boutique resort

reviews.text: Ilha Grande is beatiful (do go to Lopes Mendes beach) and Sagu is a good choice there
reviews.title: Beautiful, best location and amazing service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort was lovely and the location excellent if you want to be close to everything but not in the center of everything and want convenience: a fifteen minute walk along the beach to the center of Abraao. The damper on our trip was that the staff seemed startled that we were a Black couple and therefore they did not know how to act. That meant that upon arrival we did not get the same treatment of the other non-Black couples that we later saw arriving, i.e., the introduction to the hotel, hours and location for breakfast, lunch, dinner, the location of the hidden internet/library, etc. There was initially no energy in our room which we had to inform reception. Had he not just dumped us outside our door and said, here is your room, and entered and turned on the light for us and done the normal thing, he would have known that. They were also not very helpful organizing massages, etc. I could have dealt with this; however, the lowest point came when the reception attendant, assuming that we were of course NOT hotel guests, did not want us to take the key to our room (we had left the key as a sign instructed to do and were trying to pick it up as we had seen other couples do with no problem). She was so confused by her mistake and the fact that we were guests that she didn't even apologize. The hotel has only 9 rooms so you would think they could remember who their guests are.
reviews.title: Pretty Place But Staff Nervous about Blacks -- BEWARE
Beautiful and Relaxing
reviews.text: I stayed at Sagu in August during the "down season" and had a wonderful time. The (mini) resort itself is stunningly beautiful: on the water with gorgeous views of the water and island.
The staff at Sagu could not have been better: courteous, professional and very accomodating.
reviews.title: Criminal management

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really enjoyed Ilha Grande itself as well. A very low-key and relaxed town (at least in the off-season) but with a buch of restaurant choices and day trip options.
reviews.title: Sagu: Sagalike Maxi Resort.

likes.disliked: — we did not disapprove of anything, but deficient internet and tricky trail maybe objectionable .

reviews.title: Very nice place to stay
reviews.text: If you're looking for a relaxed and stress-free place- this is your place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderful stay, stunning views, beautiful island, long walks with friendly dogs. Staff at the Sagu were extremely friendly and helpful with everything we asked for. At least 5 spoke English fluently. Went out of their way to help us from confirming flights and negotiating transfers to appearing one day outside our room with a local fruit we had enquired about, set out on a silver tray with explanation and demonstration of how to eat it.
reviews.title: Beautiful and Relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food at Sagu was fantastic, though it might have done more for vegetarians. The owner is Italian and has imported his own authentic excellent cuisine.
reviews.title: It was really the place we were looking for
Nice hotel but much better restaurant...
reviews.text: We have travelled to many places around the world and this resort and island really stand out - relaxing, friendly, very safe and seemingly only one vehicle on the island.
If you do stay here make sure you take a torch to return from the village.
reviews.title: Pleasant Place to Stay on Ilha Grande

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Since we arrived in Rio from Foz de Iguaçu we anxiously expected to visit this famous Ilha Grande. The arrival on the island with its wonderful view suppurated our expectations. At the dock, the Sagu crew was already waiting for us, Marquinho a really handful sailorman, took us to Sagu in just 5 minutes. At the front desk we were received with sympathy and courtesy. Regarding to other “posadas” that we have seen in the main village, our room but specially the entire Sagu, was integrate in the middle of the nature, with birds, turtles, little monkeys and even squirrels!! The two best things about the room was the big bathroom and the great view of the bay provided by our terrace. There are other things to tell but the restaurant …. was the best risotto of sea food that we never had before… It really worth’s a visit!
reviews.title: Great position and resturant but other service not good value for money
